name: Hyporheic Exchange Indicators
functionStatement: Surface water-groundwater exchange moderates temperature, transforms nutrients, supplies oxygen, and supports aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: "Diverse bedforms enhance surface-subsurface exchange, matching reference morphology. Springs/seeps/subsurface flow show active hyporheic exchange, matching local reference."
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Count riffle-pool or other bedform features per 100 m using imagery and a field check. Count active upwelling spots, springs, seeps, or other infiltration indicators during a field visit."

inputs.label: Hyporheic Exchange Indicators
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Well developed bedforms and strong potential for exchange. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some bedform variety but partially uniform. / Mostly uniform run with limited exchange. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Featureless or silted bed with negligible exchange. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: High-resolution imagery and LiDAR hillshade (where available)
